text:
23/4 update:
The food stall and the whole Kopitiam is currently closed.

March 24:
Vegetable rice here is not recommended.

Over priced food.
Fried rice $3, pork ribs 4pcs $3.5, sweet sour pork 5pcs $1,

Fried rice $3, 1 chicken cutlet $5, long bean $2

Crazily small portions. You guys really need to review your price.

Chang Cheng Mee Wah
Blk 803 King George Ave
Coffeehouse

Aunty V Pig Organ Soup

Pig Kidney Soup@S$6.50
-Soup was not too herbal but was refreshing a little pepper corns inside e soup, big and thick kidney pieces fresh & succulent.

....

Kway Chap @S$4.50+S$0.50
-Soup was not dark and herbal , colour might look dull but taste wise was very freshing and not sweet.

Other kway chap ingredients was very fresh and tender nicely cooked. Tofu was not the normal sort tho.

My 2nd vist to Try the Pig Kidney soup.
----

Limited food selection here as a few of the stalls are either closed down (at least 2, you can see the advertisement to rent out stall) or not operating (fish head steamboat) in the morning. The roasted duck is nice but not the noodles. Thereâ€™s an Indian Muslim stall, a roasted meat, rice and noodle stall and a mixed dishes rice stall. The coffee here is average but can be better. :)
Try the fried oyster, kway teow & carrot cakes here. They are not very oily if you choose to have it that way. Have an outlet at blk 27 Jalan Berseh. Rest day every Wednesday.
Another spot for dinner. I tried their pineapple fried rice, quite satisfied with the portion given.
